p: In its basic form, the meaning of resilience incorporates the idea of self-organization after experiencing a shock. Ecologists and social scientists conceptualized ‘resilience’ in various ways. The resilience process of a system has two discrete elements: a significant amount of disturbance that can destroy or disrupt the system, and the system’s resilience capacity to withstand, adapt to, or recover from the traumatic event [ 49, 50].
